title: Two Sum
statement: Given an integer array nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.

algorithms.label: Traverse the array once while storing complements in a hash map.
Check every pair with a double nested loop.
Sort values then move two pointers toward each other.

implementations.label: Iterate once with a Dictionary<int, int> that maps value to index; return when a complement is found.
Use two for-loops to test all index combinations until a sum matches the target.
Order the array with indices preserved, then use two pointers to search for the target sum.

timeComplexities.label: O(n) time using a single pass hash map.
O(n log n) time due to sorting before scanning.
O(n^2) time from evaluating all pairs.

spaceComplexities.label: O(n) space for the hash map of seen values.
O(log n) auxiliary space from sorting stack frames.
O(1) extra space by scanning the array in-place.
